before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"6uk9","text":"The primer sequences without linker, pad, barcode, or adapter are as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tdk6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bd3ku","text":"Updated sequences: 515F (Parada)–806R (Apprill), forward-barcoded:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8d5b2","text":"FWD:GTGYCAGCMGCCGCGGTAA; REV:GGACTACNVGGGTWTCTAAT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fl3s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbe8d","text":"Original sequences: 515F (Caporaso)–806R (Caporaso), reverse-barcoded:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d51hf","text":"FWD:GTGCCAGCMGCCGCGGTAA; REV:GGACTACHVGGGTWTCTAAT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6am6d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c31c7","text":"Note: Primers used for PCR reaction(s) are determined by project and or lab.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7852c","text":"The 16S protocol detailed here is designed to amplify prokaryotes (bacteria and archaea) using paired-end 16S community sequencing on the Illumina platform. Primers 515F–806R target the V4 region of the 16S SSU rRNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"22t2v","text":"Decontaminate a PCR hood with DNA Away and Ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9orgu","text":"Place materials inside of the PCR Hood (refer to materials section).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6nh70","text":"Turn on the UV setting for at least  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"77atj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"60FC7C20E39311ECB20C8D9D65A284A7","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aqp77","text":"Pour PCR water into a 50mL conical and make the master mix (specific to  project and or number of samples).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dl58m","text":"Label unskirted plate(s) with the following: Project, Extraction Name, Initials, Date, \u0026 Plate Number","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":44,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dvgrh","text":"Using a 200uL 12-channel pipette, pipette   of master mix into each well on each unskirted plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":42,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fibbb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nuf5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"71pek","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"umjm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"22","error":false,"guid":"D197BC50E39411ECB20C8D9D65A284A7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"44e6h","text":"Note: Samples will be amplified in triplicate. This means that each sample will be amplified in 3 replicate 25uL PCR reactions. This ensures that enough amplicons are created for subsequent preparations. Triplicate PCR reactions for each sample will be pooled together during EGels.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"35ln","text":"Once finished, retrieve EMP   Reverse Primer Plate and DNA plate. Let thaw and spin down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dr962","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"C57B2650E39411ECB20C8D9D65A284A7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fbg4u","text":"Add   of Reverse Primer according to the plate map specific for the project and sample(s).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5no0m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"DB65A760E39411ECB20C8D9D65A284A7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8077o","text":"Add   of sample according to the plate map specific for the project and sample(s).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6it81","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"51764DF0E39611ECB20C8D9D65A284A7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1iebt","text":"Seal everything with PCR and or freezer seals and clean the PCR hood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"crfqf","text":"Return sample(s), reagents, and EMP Reverse Primer plate to the appropriate freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dmblc","text":"Place plate(s) on the thermalcycler and start an amplification protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e8j8e","text":"Once the PCR has finished on the thermalcycler, place PCR plate(s) in a   freezer or run a gel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":72,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"605do","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"E8D18ED0E39611ECB20C8D9D65A284A7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d5vto","text":"Use the following thermocycler conditions as a part of this earth microbiome project (EMP) protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pej7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7pu8i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0":{"0":"C"},"1":{"0":"_"},"2":{"0":"6"},"A_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_6":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_6":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_6":{"className":"_dt-h-center"}},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100],"data":[["98C","3 mins","1x"],["98C","45 secs","30x"],["50C","60 secs","30x"],["72C","90 secs","30x"],["72C","10 mins","1x"],["4C","hold",""]],"guid":"88C1BFD0E5AB11ECBFDAC39C802842F8","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"89dng","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["98C","3 mins","1x"],["98C","45 secs","30x"],["50C","60 secs","30x"],["72C","90 secs","30x"],["72C","10 mins","1x"],["4C","hold",""]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7nk4g","text":"Prepare PCR cocktail calculations and a plate map for all PCR reactions using barcoded primers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7d8lh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fv68","text":"The following calculations must be made based on the number of samples to be amplified:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vkc8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d500v","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8vvop","text":"Note: The numbers used above are only for demonstration purposes. If calculating the amount of PCR reagents necessary for a set of PCR reactions, calculate using the demonstrated concentrations and volumes per reaction. Typically, every 6 triplicates (or 6 samples + NTCs) requires an input of 25 samples. Therefore, 1 unskirted plate of PCR reactions equates to 100 samples (as the required input to the PCR cocktail calculator as shown above).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3p35","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AFA64D90E5AC11ECBFDAC39C802842F8","height":298,"id":251281,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hxnvbuaa7.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hxntbuaa7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hxnubuaa7.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hxnsbuaa7.webp","width":550}}}}

title: EMP 16S rRNA PCR
